pr_title: Only schedule AlterIsr thread when we have an ISR change

timeline.message: Only schedule AlterIsr thread when we have an ISR change

timeline.bodyText:
The 50ms delay here acts like a simplistic linger time to allow ISR updates to batch. If we schedule the thread immediately after the first call to enqueue, we'll likely only send a single partition in the AlterIsr request. With the small delay, we give partitions a chance to accumulate for sending as one batch.
We might consider adding a real linger time with maximum delay if we find that we're sending inefficient batches in practice.
timeline.author: mumrah

replies.bodyText: The linger attempt feels a tad clumsy. I wonder if it is necessary. With the constraint of only having one inflight request, I think we will end up batching effectively when the rate of requests goes up. Most importantly, we'll be able to batch effectively when the controller is slow to respond. Would this be complex to implement?

timeline.bodyText:
This seems to introduce a race condition. Say we have an inflight request. Is the following sequence possible?

the response returns and the io thread calls propagateIsrChanges and sees an empty unsentIsrUpdates
request thread calls submit and inserts a new item in unsentIsrUpdates
request thread fails compareAndSet on inflightRequest
io thread clears inflightRequest

It seems like we might need a lock.
timeline.author: hachikuji

replies.bodyText: You're right, there's a race between the isEmpty check and clearing the inflight flag. Good catch

timeline.author: hachikuji

timeline.bodyText: Just doublechecking our locking order. When we call submit from Partition, we first have the leader and ISR write lock and then we acquire the inflight lock added here. Now when we call handleAlterIsrResponse, we may need to reacquire the leader and ISR write lock, but that is ok, because do not need to hold the inflight lock when we do so. I think it might be worth adding some comments on the locking order somewhere in this class since the use of the leader and ISR lock is kind of hidden.
